document_data.caption: A duergar assassin of the Forak-Erach-Naek prepares to strike.
document_data.name: Empty-Scabbard Killers
document_data.mainbody: The '''Empty-Scabbard Killers''', or '''''Forak-Erach-Naek''''' in an obscure [[Dwarvish]] dialect, were a legendary order of [[duergar]] [[psionic]] assassins in [[Gracklstugh]], whom common people believed to be mythical.{{Cite web/Class Chronicles: Psionic Races and Classes (Blues, Duergar, and Elans)}}
document_data.Members: Members were often [[assassin]]s and [[soulknife|soulknives]], who could manifest a blade of psychic energy,<ref> hence the name "empty scabbard".
document_data.Operations:
Empty-Scabbard Killers patrolled the streets of Gracklstugh searching for psionically gifted children to abduct and train. They even recruited gifted ''[[calassabrak]]'' (a kind of duergar outlaw shunned by other duergar).

They usually conducted deadly missions for a select few personalities of the city, However, they would work and kill for anyone who had the [[gold]].
document_data.Base: The headquarters of the Forak-Erach-Naek was a well-guarded secret. However, those who would hire them knew they could get in contact with one of the killers in the [[Cave of Twelve Teeth]], which stood by the edge of the [[Darklake]] just outside Gracklstugh. They were possibly based near the Darklake.
document_data.History:
The Empty-Scabbard Killers were already notorious by [[1373 DR]]. By then, they'd recently extended their services to kidnapping for ransom.

Around [[1374 DR]], the Forak-Erach-Naek attempted to assassinate [[Urdol]], the [[aboleth]] ruler of [[Dupapn]]. They failed, and Urdol declared war on the Forak-Erach-Naek in retaliation, a situation that would quickly and almost certainly erupt into chaos.

''Circa'' [[1486 DR]], they—for unknown reasons—targeted the merchant [[Werz Saltbaron]].
